intro: Anthemis hinkovae, commonly known as the Hinkov's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive, aromatic scent, and it produces small, oblong fruits known as cypselae. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Anthemis hinkovae is considered a rare and endangered species.
